page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY UP TO c1800
page.content: The earliest record of inhabitants of the Bishopton district stems from the 2nd Century A.D. during the Roman occupation. The House of Bishopton, or Bishoptoun, thought itself to derive from "Bishop's Toun", was an ancient country retreat of the Bishop of Paisley. Bishopton as a village probably dates from the early 18th Century, when the Old Greenock Road was built, and was centred about the west end of the present village, site of the Bishopton Old Inn. Robert Burns's brother is buried in the local cemetery.
